{{incomplete}} {{scene |name=The Departure of The Fellowship |film=[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring]] | image = The Lord of the Rings - The Fellowship of the Ring - The Departure of the Fellowship from Rivendell.png |number=30 (extended) |duration=01:17 |event=The [[Fellowship of the Ring]] departs [[Rivendell]] |characters=[[Elrond]], [[Fellowship of the Ring]]
[[Arwen]] |previous=[[Bilbo's Gifts]] |next=[[The Ring Goes South (scene)|The Ring Goes South]] }} '''The Departure of the Fellowship''' is the thirtieth scene of [[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (extended edition)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring'' (extended edition)]]. This scene was not featured in the theatrical release of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring]]''. ==Synopsis== With the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] ready to depart [[Rivendell]], [[Elrond]] re-iterates the [[Frodo|Ring-bearer's]] quest is for [[Mount Doom]] and that there is no obligation for those travelling with him to go further than they wish. He bids them blessings for their journey and [[Gandalf]] then tells [[Frodo]] they are ready to leave. The hobbit looks around somewhat nervously as he asks "[[Mordor]] Gandalf, is it left or right?" In response, the wizard tells him "Left". [[Aragorn]] shares a last long look with [[Arwen]] before he gives her a slight nod and smile and follows the rest of the [[Fellowship]] over the bridge out of Rivendell. [[Category:The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring scenes|30]]
